intro: Eschweilera hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras ceiba, is a tropical tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and towering height. The tree produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for wildlife.
